elements.title: Tulainyo Lake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1937, water from Tulainyo Lake (pictured) was carried by runner, horseback, donkey, covered wagon, twenty-mule team, stagecoach, train, car, and plane to Death Valley to mark a highway opening?

elements.title: The Last of Us Part I (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Last of Us Part I features three accessibility presets for those requiring hearing, motor, or visual aids?

elements.title: Earle M. Chiles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Earle M. Chiles, a businessman and philanthropist from Portland, Oregon, was also a senator of the board of Ludwig Maximilian University in Munich, Germany?

elements.title: This Census-Taker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that China Miéville's novella This Census-Taker fluctuates between the first and third person to convey the trauma felt by the protagonist?

elements.title: Port of Tanjung Api-Api (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the development of the Port of Tanjung Api-Api resulted in a bribery scandal implicating the incumbent governor?

elements.title: Open Philanthropy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Open Philanthropy has made grants to causes ranging from recession prevention to cancer vaccines for dogs?

elements.title: Danylo Matviienko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ukrainian baritone Danylo Matviienko, who holds a master's degree in mathematics, appeared as Demetrius in Britten's opera A Midsummer Night's Dream at the Oper Frankfurt?

elements.title: Univel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Univel was an early-1990s attempt to compete with Microsoft on the desktop, but one industry consultant said of the company's goal, "they're dreaming"?
